sen.j: 二尊院（にそんいん）は、京都市右京区の嵯峨野にある天台宗の寺院。
sen.e: Nison-in Temple is a Tendai Sect Buddhist temple located in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Nison-in Temple is a Tendai Sect Buddhist temple located in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Nison-in Temple is a Tendai Sect Buddhist temple located in Sagano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 山号は小倉山。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is Ogurayama.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Ogurayama.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Mt. Ogura.
sen.cmt: 小倉山→Mt. Oguraとしました。

sen.j: 詳しくは、小倉山二尊教院華台寺という。
sen.e: It is formally known as Ogurayama Nison-in Keidai-ji Temple.
It is formally known as Ogurayama Nison-in Keidai-ji Temple.
It is formally known as Ogurayama Nison-in Keidai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 二尊院の名は、本尊の「発遣の釈迦」と「来迎の阿弥陀」の二如来像による。
sen.e: Nison-in (lit. Two Images Temple) derives its name from the fact that there are two principal image statues; Hokke-no-Shaka and Raigei-no-Amida.
Nison-in (lit. Two Images Temple) derives its name from the fact that there are two principal image statues; Hokke-no-Shaka and Raigei-no-Amida.
Nison-in (lit. Two Images Temple) derives its name from the fact that there are two principal image statues; Hokke no Shaka and Raigei no Amida.
sen.cmt: ハイフンをとり、Hokke no Shaka, Raigei no Amidaとしました。

sen.j: 境内の墓地には、角倉了以、三条実美、阪東妻三郎らの墓がある。
sen.e: The cemetery within the temple precinct contains the graves of Ryoi SUMINOKURA, Saneomi SANJO and Tsumasaburo BANDO.
The cemetery within the temple precinct contains the graves of Ryoi SUMINOKURA, Saneomi SANJO and Tsumasaburo BANDO.
The cemetery within the temple precincts contains the graves of Ryoi SUMINOKURA, Saneomi SANJO and Tsumasaburo BANDO.

sen.j: 総門を入った「紅葉の馬場｣と呼ばれる参道は、紅葉の名所として知られる。
sen.e: The path known as "Momiji no Baba" (lit. Autumn Leaf Horse-Riding Ground) that extends from the main gate is famous for its beautiful autumn leaves.
The path known as "Momiji no Baba" (lit. Autumn Leaf Horse-Riding Ground) that extends from the main gate is famous for its beautiful autumn leaves.
The path known as 'Momiji no Baba' (lit. Autumn Leaf Horse-Riding Ground) that extends from the main gate is famous for its beautiful autumn leaves.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: また、奥には、百人一首ゆかりの、藤原定家の時雨亭跡とされる場所がある。
sen.e: Within the temple grounds is a place believed to be the remains of the Shigure-tei Teahouse of FUJIWARA no Sadaie (or Teika) who compiled the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu anthology of poetry.
Within the temple grounds is a place believed to be the remains of the Shigure-tei Teahouse of FUJIWARA no Sadaie (or Teika) who compiled the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu anthology of poetry.
Within the temple grounds is a place believed to be the remains of the Shigure-tei Teahouse of FUJIWARA no Sadaie (or Teika) who compiled the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu anthology of poetry.

sen.j: 平安時代初期の承和 (日本)年中（834年 - 847年）、嵯峨天皇の勅により円仁（慈覚大師）が建立したと伝える。
sen.e: Nison-in Temple is said to have been constructed in the early Heian period between 834 and 847 by Ennin (Jikaku Daishi) under the order of Emperor Saga.
Nison-in Temple is said to have been constructed in the early Heian period between 834 and 847 by Ennin (Jikaku Daishi) under the order of Emperor Saga.
Nison-in Temple is said to have been constructed in the early Heian period between 834 and 847 by Ennin (Jikaku Daishi) under the order of Emperor Saga.

sen.j: 以後、荒廃するが、鎌倉時代初期、法然の高弟である湛空らにより再興される。
sen.e: It later fell into ruin but was revived in the early Kamakura period by Tanku, a high-ranking disciple of Honen.
It later fell into ruin but was revived in the early Kamakura period by Tanku, a high-ranking disciple of Honen.
It later fell into ruin but was revived in the early Kamakura period by Tanku, a high-ranking disciple of Honen.

sen.j: 応仁の乱により堂塔伽藍が全焼するが、本堂と唐門が約30年後の永正18年（1521年）に再建された。
sen.e: The temple buildings were completely destroyed by fire during the Onin War but the main hall and kara-mon gate were rebuilt approximately 300 years later in 1521.
The temple buildings were completely destroyed by fire during the Onin War but the main hall and kara-mon gate were rebuilt approximately 300 years later in 1521.
The temple buildings were completely destroyed by fire during the Onin War but the main hall and kara-mon gate (Chinese-style gate) were rebuilt approximately 30 years later in 1521.
sen.cmt: 300 years→30 yearsに訂正、kara-mon gateの補足を入れました。(参照:http://tangorin.com/words/karamon)

sen.j: 本堂 - 永正18年（1521年）の再建
sen.e: Main hall: Reconstructed in 1521
Main hall: Reconstructed in 1521
Main hall: Reconstructed in 1521

sen.j: 勅使門（唐門） - 永正18年（1521年）の再建。
sen.e: Chokushi-mon (imperial messenger gate) (Kara-mon gate): Reconstructed in 1521
Chokushi-mon (imperial messenger gate) (Kara-mon gate): Reconstructed in 1521
Chokushi-mon gate (imperial messenger gate) (Kara-mon gate): Reconstructed in 1521

sen.j: 総門 - 伏見城の薬医門を移築したものとされる
sen.e: Main gate: Thought to be the Yakui-mon gate relocated from Fushimi Castle
Main gate: Thought to be the Yakui-mon gate relocated from Fushimi Castle
Main gate: Thought to be the Yakui-mon gate (a gate where one roof covers both the main front pillars and the rear support pillars) relocated from Fushimi-jo Castle
sen.cmt: Fushimi-jo Castleとし、薬医門の補足を入れました。(参照: http://www.jcastle.info/resources/view/81)

sen.j: 八社ノ宮 - 室町時代建立
sen.e: Hassha-no-miya: Constructed during the Muromachi period
Hassha-no-miya: Constructed during the Muromachi period
Hassha no miya: Constructed during the Muromachi period

sen.j: 弁財天堂
sen.e: Benzaiten-do (hall devoted to the goddess Saraswati)
Benzaiten-do (hall devoted to the goddess Saraswati)
Benzaiten-do hall (hall devoted to the goddess Saraswati)

sen.j: 鐘楼
sen.e: Belfry
Belfry
Belfry

sen.j: 境内には公家の二条家、三条家、四条家、三条西家、鷹司家の墓地のほか、伊藤仁斎・伊藤東涯父子、角倉了以・角倉素庵父子の墓などがある。
sen.e: The temple grounds contain the graves of many court nobles including the Nijo family, the Sanjo family, the Shijo family, the Sanjonishi family, the Takatsukasa family, Jinsai ITO, Togai ITO and Soan SUMINOKURA.

The temple grounds contain the graves of many court nobles including the Nijo family, the Sanjo family, the Shijo family, the Sanjonishi family, the Takatsukasa family, Jinsai ITO, Togai ITO and Soan SUMINOKURA.

The temple grounds contain the graves of many court nobles including the Nijo family, the Sanjo family, the Shijo family, the Sanjonishi family, the Takatsukasa family, Jinsai ITO, Togai ITO, Ryoi SUMINOKURA and Soan SUMINOKURA.

sen.j: また境内奥には土御門天皇、後嵯峨天皇、亀山天皇の分骨を安置する三帝陵がある。
sen.e: Within the inner area of the temple precinct also stands a Santeiryo (lit. Three Emperor Tomb) which contains some of the ashes of Emperor Tsuchimikado, Emperor Go-Saga and Emperor Kameyama.
Within the inner area of the temple precinct also stands a Santeiryo (lit. Three Emperor Tomb) which contains some of the ashes of Emperor Tsuchimikado, Emperor Go-Saga and Emperor Kameyama.
Within the inner area of the temple precincts also stands a Santeiryo (lit. Three Emperor Tomb) which contains some of the ashes of Emperor Tsuchimikado, Emperor Gosaga and Emperor Kameyama.

sen.j: 重要文化財
sen.e: Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties

sen.j: 木造釈迦如来立像・阿弥陀如来立像
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Shaka Nyorai and wooden standing statue of Amida Nyorai
Wooden standing statue of Shaka Nyorai and wooden standing statue of Amida Nyorai
Wooden standing statue of Shaka Nyorai and wooden standing statue of Amida Nyorai

sen.j: 本堂に安置。
sen.e: Housed inside the main hall.
Housed inside the main hall.
Housed inside the main hall.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の作。
sen.e: Created during the Kamakura period.
Created during the Kamakura period.
Created during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 向かって右に発遣（ほっけん、現世から来世へと送り出す）の釈迦如来、左に来迎（西方極楽浄土へ迎え入れる）の阿弥陀如来が並び立つ。
sen.e: On the right stands Hokken-no-Shaka Nyorai ("Hokken" refers to the sending of people from this world to the next) and on the left stands Raigei-no Amida Nyorai (who welcomes souls into the Western Pure Land Paradise).

On the right stands Hokken-no-Shaka Nyorai ("Hokken" refers to the sending of people from this world to the next) and on the left stands Raigei-no Amida Nyorai (who welcomes souls into the Western Pure Land Paradise).

On the right stands Hokken no Shaka Nyorai ("Hokken" refers to the sending of people from this world to the next) and on the left stands Raigei no Amida Nyorai (who welcomes souls into the Western Pure Land Paradise).
sen.cmt: ハイフンをとり、Hokken no Shaka Nyorai, Raigei no Amida Nyoraiとしました。

sen.j: 両像はよく似ているが、両脚部の衣文の形式などに変化をつけている。
sen.e: The appearance of the clothes worn by both statues is very similar but there are differences such as the design of the legs.
The appearance of the clothes worn by both statues is very similar but there are differences such as the design of the legs.
The appearance of the clothes worn by both statues is very similar but there are differences such as the design of the legs.

sen.j: 通常の阿弥陀如来像は親指と人差し指（または中指、薬指）で輪をつくる印相を結ぶが、当寺の阿弥陀如来像は下げた右手の指を5本とも真っ直ぐ伸ばしている点が珍しい。
sen.e: Statues of Amida Nyorai ordinarily depict him forming a circular mudra (Buddhist hand gesture) with the thumb and index finger (or middle finger and ring finger) but the Amida Statue of Nison-in Temple is unique as all five fingers on its lowered right hand are straight.

Statues of Amida Nyorai ordinarily depict him forming a circular mudra (Buddhist hand gesture) with the thumb and index finger (or middle finger and ring finger) but the Amida Statue of Nison-in Temple is unique as all five fingers on its lowered right hand are straight.

Statues of Amida Nyorai ordinarily depict him forming a circular mudra (Buddhist hand gesture) with the thumb and index finger (or middle finger and ring finger) but the Amida Statue of Nison-in Temple is unique as all five fingers on its lowered right hand are straight.

sen.j: 本堂勅額 - 後奈良天皇筆、｢二尊院｣。

sen.j: 京都市右京区嵯峨二尊院門前長神町27
sen.e: 27 Saga Nison-in Monzen Chojin-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City
27 Saga Nison-in Monzen Chojin-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City
27 Saga Nison-in Monzen Chojin-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 京都市バス、京都バス、「嵯峨小学校」バス停下車、徒歩15分
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus or Kyoto Bus to "Saga Shogakko" (Saga Elementary School) bus stop and walk for 15 minutes.
Take the Kyoto City Bus or Kyoto Bus to "Saga Shogakko" (Saga Elementary School) bus stop and walk for 15 minutes.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道嵯峨野線、「嵯峨嵐山駅」下車、徒歩20分
sen.e: Take the JR West Sagano Line to "Saga Arashiyama Station" and walk for 20 minutes.
Take the JR West Sagano Line to "Saga Arashiyama Station" and walk for 20 minutes.

sen.j: 嵯峨野観光鉄道嵯峨野観光線、トロッコ嵐山駅下車、徒歩5分
sen.e: Take the Sagano Scenic Line of the Sagano Scenic Railway to Torokko Arashiyama Station and walk for 5 minutes.
